intro: Campuleia coccinea, commonly known as the red campion, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, bright red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the stems are often hairy. Campuleia coccinea thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland habitats.
